Title: [Job Master][Report Access]Verify that User can open Job Master Report successfully
Description: Verify that user can successfully navigate to and open the Job Master Report page
Precondition: 1. User has valid credentials; 2. User is logged into system; 3. Job Master page is accessible
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Master Report URL; 2. Verify page loads completely; 3. Check for Today's jobs section; 4. Verify page title displays correctly; 5. Confirm navigation menu is visible; 6. Check for filter options availability; 7. Validate page responsiveness
Expected Result: 1. Job Master Report page loads successfully; 2. Page displays complete content without errors; 3. Today's jobs section is visible and populated; 4. Page title shows 'Job Master Report' correctly; 5. Navigation menu is accessible and functional; 6. All filter options are available for use; 7. Page responds properly to user interactions
Test Data: Login: valid credentials; Environment: staging.app.exampleplatform.com

Title: [Job Master][Search Functionality]Verify that User can search jobs by title successfully
Description: Verify that user can search and filter jobs using the job title search functionality
Precondition: 1. Job Master page is loaded; 2. Job data is available in system; 3. Search functionality is accessible
Steps: 1. Locate job title search input field; 2. Enter specific job title in search field; 3. Verify entered text appears correctly; 4. Click Filter button; 5. Wait for system processing; 6. Verify filter is applied; 7. Confirm filtered results display
Expected Result: 1. Job title search field is visible and accessible; 2. Job title text is entered correctly in search field; 3. Entered text displays as expected; 4. Filter button click triggers search action; 5. System processes search request successfully; 6. Filter is applied to job list; 7. Filtered results display matching job titles
Test Data: Job title: SGAP-CICL-2222; Filter button available

Title: [Job Master][Reference Search]Verify that User can search jobs by customer reference successfully
Description: Verify that user can search jobs using customer reference numbers for accurate results
Precondition: 1. Job Master page is loaded; 2. Customer reference data exists in system; 3. Search functionality is operational
Steps: 1. Locate customer reference search input field; 2. Enter specific reference number in search field; 3. Verify reference number is entered correctly; 4. Click Filter button to apply search; 5. Wait for system to process search; 6. Verify search results are filtered; 7. Confirm matching job appears in results
Expected Result: 1. Customer reference search field is visible and accessible; 2. Reference number is entered correctly in search field; 3. Entered reference number displays as expected; 4. Filter button click triggers customer reference search; 5. System processes customer reference search successfully; 6. Search results are filtered by customer reference; 7. Matching job with correct reference number appears in results
Test Data: Reference: REF SGAP-ICL3-DISTR-00; Search field available

Specific customer is selected successfully from dropdown; 5. Filter button click applies customer filter; 6. System processes customer filter selection; 7. Job list updates to show only jobs for selected customer

Title: [Job Master][Vehicle Run Sheet Button]Verify that User can view Vehicle Run Sheet button for eligible jobs successfully
Description: Verify that Go to Vehicle Run Sheet button appears only when at least one load is completed
Precondition: 1. Job list is loaded in Job Master; 2. Jobs with different load statuses exist; 3. Vehicle Run Sheet button functionality is available
Steps: 1. Locate job rows in the job list table; 2. Verify presence of Vehicle Run Sheet button per job row; 3. Check load statuses for each job; 4. Identify jobs with completed loads; 5. Verify button appears for jobs with completed loads; 6. Confirm button is not visible for jobs without completed loads; 7. Validate button functionality for eligible jobs
Expected Result: 1. Job rows are visible in the job list table; 2. Vehicle Run Sheet button is present for eligible job rows; 3. Load statuses are displayed correctly for each job; 4. Jobs with completed loads are identified; 5. Vehicle Run Sheet button appears only for jobs with completed loads; 6. Button is not visible for jobs without completed loads; 7. Button functionality is validated for eligible jobs
Test Data: Load statuses available; Jobs with mixed load statuses

Title: [Job Master][Job Status Logic]Verify that User can understand consolidated job status logic successfully
Description: Verify that job status reflects accurate consolidated load status based on business logic
Precondition: 1. Job list is loaded in Job Master; 2. Jobs with mixed load statuses exist; 3. Job status logic is implemented
Steps: 1. Review job status logic rules in system; 2. Identify jobs with all loads in Planning status; 3. Verify jobs with at least one Scheduled load; 4. Check jobs with Scheduled Notified loads; 5. Validate jobs with In Progress loads; 6. Confirm jobs with all completed loads; 7. Verify terminated job status handling
Expected Result: 1. Job status logic rules are clearly defined and implemented; 2. Jobs with all Planning loads show Planning status; 3. Jobs with at least one Scheduled load show Scheduled status; 4. Jobs with Scheduled Notified loads show Scheduled Notified status; 5. Jobs with In Progress loads show In Progress status; 6. Jobs with all completed loads show Completed status; 7. Terminated jobs show Terminated status correctly
Test Data: Mixed load statuses available; Jobs with various load combinations

Driver and assistant assignments are created; 5. Trailer configurations are included in test data; 6. Contract links and financial data are added; 7. Comprehensive test dataset covers all filter and validation scenarios
Test Data: Full system data set available; Test data creation tools accessible

Title: [Job Master][Filter Application]Verify that User can apply filters only after clicking Filter button successfully

Job list display is observed and monitored; 5. Job list remains unchanged until Filter button is clicked; 6. Filter button click triggers filter application; 7. Filters are applied successfully after button click

Description: Verify that planned, total, and unplanned stop counts are correct and traceable
Precondition: 1. Valid trip history exists in system; 2. Stop count data is available; 3. Validation tools are accessible
Steps: 1. Locate stop count fields in Job Master interface; 2. Access trip history data for selected job; 3. Verify planned stops count accuracy; 4. Check total stops count validity; 5. Validate unplanned stops count; 6. Confirm counts are traceable to stops; 7. Document any count discrepancies
Expected Result: 1. Stop count fields are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Trip history data is accessible for selected job; 3. Planned stops count is verified as accurate; 4. Total stops count is confirmed as valid; 5. Unplanned stops count is validated; 6. All counts are confirmed as traceable to stops; 7. Stop count accuracy is validated and documented
Test Data: Valid trip history available; Stop count data accessible

Title: [Job Master][Distance Accuracy]Verify that User can validate distance field accuracy successfully
Description: Verify that planned, GPS, and odometer distance values are within allowed variance
Precondition: 1. Distance records exist in GPS logs; 2. Distance fields are displayed in UI; 3. Comparison tools are available
Steps: 1. Locate distance fields in Job Master interface; 2. Access GPS logs for distance comparison; 3. Compare planned distance with GPS data; 4. Verify GPS distance accuracy; 5. Check odometer distance values; 6. Validate distance variance limits; 7. Confirm all distance fields are accurate
Expected Result: 1. Distance fields are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. GPS logs are accessible for distance comparison; 3. Planned distance comparison with GPS data is initiated; 4. GPS distance accuracy is verified; 5. Odometer distance values are checked; 6. Distance variance limits are validated; 7. All distance fields are confirmed as accurate
Test Data: Distance records in GPS logs; Distance fields displayed in UI

Title: [Job Master][Dwell Time Validation]Verify that User can validate dwell time calculation successfully
Description: Verify that Actual - Planned = Variance calculation is correct and logical
Precondition: 1. Dwell data is available in system; 2. Dwell time fields are displayed; 3. Calculation validation tools exist
Steps: 1. Locate dwell time fields in Job Master interface; 2. Access actual dwell time data for selected job; 3. Verify planned dwell time information; 4. Calculate variance using Actual - Planned formula; 5. Compare calculated variance with displayed value; 6. Confirm calculation logic is correct; 7. Validate dwell time field accuracy
Expected Result: 1. Dwell time fields are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Actual dwell time data is accessible for selected job; 3. Planned dwell time information is displayed; 4. Variance calculation using Actual - Planned formula is performed; 5. Calculated variance is compared with displayed value; 6. Calculation logic is confirmed as correct; 7. Dwell time field accuracy is validated successfully
Test Data: Dwell data available; Dwell time fields displayed

Title: [Job Master][Duration Comparison]Verify that User can validate job duration fields successfully
Description: Verify that planned vs actual duration fields show valid variance and actual values
Precondition: 1. Job duration data is recorded in system; 2. Duration fields are displayed in UI; 3. Comparison tools are available
Steps: 1. Locate duration fields in Job Master interface; 2. Access planned duration data for selected job; 3. Verify actual duration information; 4. Compare planned vs actual duration values; 5. Calculate duration variance; 6. Confirm variance values are valid; 7. Validate actual duration accuracy
Expected Result: 1. Duration fields are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Planned duration data is accessible for selected job; 3. Actual duration information is displayed; 4. Planned vs actual duration comparison is initiated; 5. Duration variance calculation is performed; 6. Variance values are confirmed as valid; 7. Actual duration accuracy is validated successfully
Test Data: Job duration recorded; Duration fields displayed in UI

Title: [Job Master][Timestamp Order]Verify that User can validate execution step timestamp sequence successfully
Description: Verify that Start Job, Journey, and Loading timestamps are in correct chronological order
Precondition: 1. Work order history is available in system; 2. Timestamp data is accessible; 3. Sequence validation tools exist
Steps: 1. Locate execution step timestamps in Job Master interface; 2. Access work order history for selected job; 3. Verify Start Job timestamp is recorded; 4. Check Journey timestamp sequence; 5. Validate Loading timestamp order; 6. Confirm timestamps are in correct order; 7. Validate chronological sequence accuracy
Expected Result: 1. Execution step timestamps are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Work order history is accessible for selected job; 3. Start Job timestamp is verified as recorded; 4. Journey timestamp sequence is checked; 5. Loading timestamp order is validated; 6. All timestamps are confirmed as in correct order; 7. Chronological sequence accuracy is validated successfully
Test Data: Work order history available; Timestamp data accessible

Title: [Job Master][Contract Mapping]Verify that User can validate cost/revenue contract mapping successfully
Description: Verify that contract ID, cost, and revenue fields match respective contract master data
Precondition: 1. Contract master data is available in system; 2. Contract fields are displayed in UI; 3. Mapping validation tools exist
Steps: 1. Locate contract fields in Job Master interface; 2. Access contract master data for comparison; 3. Verify contract ID field accuracy; 4. Check cost field values; 5. Validate revenue field data; 6. Compare fields with contract master; 7. Confirm all fields match respective contract
Expected Result: 1. Contract fields are visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Contract master data is accessible for comparison; 3. Contract ID field is verified as accurate; 4. Cost field values are checked; 5. Revenue field data is validated; 6. Field comparison with contract master is initiated; 7. All fields are confirmed as matching respective contract
Test Data: Contract master available; Contract fields displayed in UI

Title: [Job Master][Duplicate Detection]Verify that User can detect duplicate load or job IDs successfully
Description: Verify that no duplicate entries exist unless intentionally created
Precondition: 1. File data is parsed and accessible; 2. Duplicate detection tools are available; 3. Validation criteria are defined
Steps: 1. Locate file data in Job Master interface; 2. Access duplicate detection functionality; 3. Scan file for duplicate Job ID entries; 4. Check for duplicate Load ID entries; 5. Verify uniqueness of all identifiers; 6. Confirm no unintended duplicates exist; 7. Document any intentional duplicates
Expected Result: 1. File data is visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Duplicate detection functionality is accessible; 3. File scan for duplicate Job ID entries is initiated; 4. Duplicate Load ID entry check is performed; 5. Uniqueness of all identifiers is verified; 6. No unintended duplicates are confirmed; 7. Any intentional duplicates are documented appropriately
Test Data: File parsed; Duplicate detection tools available

Title: [Job Master][Duplicate Reference Handling]Verify that User can handle duplicate Order/Other Reference IDs successfully
Description: Verify that multiple jobs with same reference are shown when duplicate references exist
Precondition: 1. Jobs with same references exist in system; 2. Search functionality is operational; 3. Duplicate reference data is available
Steps: 1. Locate search functionality in Job Master interface; 2. Enter duplicate Order Ref ID in search field; 3. Verify search results display multiple jobs; 4. Enter duplicate Other Ref ID in search field; 5. Confirm multiple jobs appear with same reference; 6. Validate duplicate reference handling; 7. Document duplicate reference behavior
Expected Result: 1. Search functionality is visible and accessible in Job Master interface; 2. Duplicate Order Ref ID search is performed successfully; 3. Search results display multiple jobs with same reference; 4. Duplicate Other Ref ID search is performed successfully; 5. Multiple jobs appear with same reference correctly; 6. Duplicate reference handling is validated; 7. Duplicate reference behavior is documented appropriately
Test Data: Ref ID reused intentionally; Duplicate reference data available
